page.title: 16TREDINGTON,STOKE ORCHARD
page.content: Within our area of study there are two ancient{churches}serving the two villages of Tredington and Stoke Orchard. Tredington Church is dedicated to St. John the Baptist and Stoke Orchard Church is named after St. James the Great. The two villages with their two churches are one parish. Up to the earlier part of this century they were independant. Stoke Orchard being part of the parish of Bishops Cleeve. Both Churches are 12th century. Tredington is perhaps the older. Stoke Orchard church is usually dated as 1160 and has had few alterations since that time. The nave has has only one alteration - the addition of a larger window to let in more light. The chancel was rebuilt in the 14th century. What makes St. James church of historic interest are the wall paintings in the nave.
